![image2](/case11/10x_he.png)

<summary>What's your diagnosis</summary>
<br>
Ganglioneuroma

</details>


<details close>

<summary>Notes</summary>
<br>

**Definion:** <br>Benign neoplasm that originates from neural crest cells of sympathetic ganglia or adrenal medulla <br>
<br>
**Epidemiology and clinical features:** <br> Usually not in children.<br>
Posterior mediastinum commonly affected 
<br><br>
**Microscopy:** <br> Schwann cells and Ganglion cells. <br>Ganglion cells may be dysmorphic. <br>Subtypes are: with mature ganglion cells and with maturing ganglion cells.
<br><br>
**Therapy and Prognosis:** <br> Benign.<br> 

**Reference:** <br>https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/adrenalganglioneuroma.html

</details>
